page.title: 07St. John's Church
page.content:
The only church in the area is St. John's Parish Church which is well situated in the "centre" of the Parish. It was{built}in the 12th. century but has been added to many times since.
It is a very beautiful building constructed in pink granite with a spire which houses a full peal of {bells.}These were restored and re-hung during the late 1970's.
Anglican{Services}take place every Sunday, often with a family service in the morning and evensong later in the day.
Many of the local children sing in the {choir}which practices once a week and a{Sunday School}meets weekly, staffed by lay volunteers.
